chest pain.clinical_note: Patient reports intermittent chest discomfort on exertion. EKG shows non-specific changes. Recommend cardiology evaluation for possible angina.

hypertension.clinical_note: Elevated BP readings over 140/90 on multiple visits. No end-organ damage noted. Patient requests specialist consultation for medication management.

arrhythmia.clinical_note: Patient experiencing palpitations and irregular heartbeat. Holter monitor ordered. Cardiology referral for rhythm evaluation.

heart murmur.clinical_note: Grade 3/6 systolic murmur noted on exam. Echocardiogram recommended. Refer to cardiology for valve assessment.

shortness of breath.clinical_note: Progressive dyspnea on exertion over past 3 months. Chest X-ray unremarkable. Cardiology evaluation needed to rule out cardiac etiology.

suspicious mole.clinical_note: Patient has atypical nevus on upper back, ABCDE criteria concerning for melanoma. Urgent dermatology referral for biopsy consideration.

severe acne.clinical_note: Persistent cystic acne unresponsive to topical treatments and oral antibiotics. Considering isotretinoin therapy, dermatology consultation needed.

psoriasis.clinical_note: Erythematous plaques with silvery scales on elbows and knees. Patient requests biologic therapy. Dermatology referral for advanced treatment options.

chronic rash.clinical_note: Persistent pruritic rash for 6 months, unresponsive to OTC treatments. Unclear etiology. Dermatology evaluation needed.

skin lesion.clinical_note: New growth on forearm, rapid expansion noted. Patient concerned about appearance and cancer risk. Dermatology referral for evaluation and possible excision.

annual physical.clinical_note: Patient due for annual wellness visit. No acute complaints. Preventive health maintenance and screening needed.

diabetes management.clinical_note: Type 2 diabetes with suboptimal glucose control. A1C 8.2%. Medication adjustment and lifestyle counseling needed.

fatigue.clinical_note: Persistent fatigue for 3 months. Initial labs pending. Primary care evaluation for comprehensive workup.

weight management.clinical_note: Patient requests weight loss consultation. BMI 32. Primary care referral for medical weight management program.

medication refill.clinical_note: Patient needs refill and review of chronic medications. Blood pressure and cholesterol monitoring indicated.

abdominal pain.clinical_note: Chronic intermittent abdominal pain, unclear etiology. Initial workup negative. Internal medicine consultation for comprehensive evaluation.

anemia.clinical_note: Persistent anemia with Hgb 9.5. Iron studies suggest iron deficiency. Internal medicine referral for further evaluation and management.

thyroid disorder.clinical_note: Abnormal TSH 12.4, suggesting hypothyroidism. Patient symptomatic with fatigue and weight gain. Endocrine evaluation needed.

joint pain.clinical_note: Polyarticular joint pain with morning stiffness. Inflammatory markers elevated. Internal medicine referral to rule out autoimmune condition.

chronic cough.clinical_note: Persistent dry cough for 4 months. Chest X-ray normal. Pulmonary function tests ordered. Internal medicine consultation needed.

abnormal mammogram.clinical_note: Mammogram shows suspicious calcifications BI-RADS 4. Biopsy recommended. Oncology referral for evaluation and treatment planning.

lymphadenopathy.clinical_note: Persistent enlarged cervical lymph nodes for 2 months. CT scan shows multiple enlarged nodes. Oncology consultation for biopsy and workup.

abnormal blood counts.clinical_note: Persistent leukocytosis with left shift. Bone marrow biopsy ordered. Hematology-oncology referral for evaluation.

weight loss.clinical_note: Unintentional 20-pound weight loss over 3 months. CT abdomen shows pancreatic mass. Urgent oncology referral.

prostate cancer.clinical_note: Elevated PSA 12.4, biopsy shows Gleason 7 adenocarcinoma. Oncology referral for staging and treatment options discussion.

developmental delay.clinical_note: 18-month-old with speech delay. Not meeting developmental milestones. Pediatric evaluation and early intervention referral needed.

asthma.clinical_note: Pediatric patient with frequent wheezing episodes. Requiring multiple albuterol treatments. Pediatric pulmonology consultation for asthma action plan.

failure to thrive.clinical_note: 6-month-old infant below 5th percentile for weight. Poor feeding noted. Pediatric evaluation for feeding disorder and nutritional assessment.

ear infection.clinical_note: Pediatric patient with recurrent ear infections and sinusitis. Immunology workup indicated. Pediatric consultation needed.

ADHD evaluation.clinical_note: 8-year-old with behavioral concerns at school. Teacher reports inattention and hyperactivity. Pediatric referral for ADHD evaluation.
